org.factcenter.qilin.comm

Interface SendableInput

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.DataInput
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Channel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalChannelFactory.LocalChannel, SendableByteArrayInputStream, SendableInputStream, TCPChannelFactory.TCPChannel

    public interface SendableInput
extends java.io.DataInput
    Extend DataInput with ability to read certain types of objects: primitive arrays, Collections, BigIntegers and objects implementing Sendable. Unlike ObjectInput, the type of object to be read must be known in advance. This allows zero overhead in the stream (object identifiers aren't sent) and a type-safe API. Reading an unsupported object type will cause a runtime exception.

      • readObject

        <T> T readObject(java.lang.Class<T> type)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Read an object of known type. The object type must have a default constructor as it will be constructed with a call to Class.newInstance(). The read object will not be null.

        <T> T readObject(T obj)
          throws java.io.IOException
